title: Calendar: month view label
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on the Calendar
custom_expected:
THEN a dark blue label appears next to the right nav arrow button
AND the label is the month
AND the month is formatted: Month YYYY

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19466)

title: Calendar: week view label
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on the Calendar
custom_expected:
THEN a dark blue label appears next to the right nav arrow button
AND the label is a date span
AND the date span is formatted: Month DD -- DD, YYYY
AND the calendar week view begins with a Sunday
AND the date span begins with that Sunday's date
AND the date span ends with that Saturday's date

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19467)

title: Calendar: day view label
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on the Calendar
custom_expected:
THEN a dark blue label appears next to the right nav arrow button
AND the label is a date
AND the date is formatted: Day, Month DD, YYYY

![](index.php?/attachments/get/19468)

title: Calendar view buttons
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Calendar page
AND three buttons have appeared in the header on the right side of the screen: Day, Week, Month
custom_steps: WHEN user taps or clicks on one of those buttons
custom_expected: THEN the calendar display changes according to the selection

title: Calendar nav buttons
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Calendar page
AND 3 buttons have appeared to the left in the header: left arrow, Today, right arrow
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on any of those 3 buttons
custom_expected:
THEN the calendar navigates appropriately:
left arrow shows previous days
right arrow shows future days
Today shows right now

title: Calendar: select event
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on the Global Calendar
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks or taps on the title of an event
custom_expected: THEN page redirects within the same tab to the selected event's individual page

title: OBSOLETE - Calendar: hover over time
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Calendar
AND events have appeared on the Calendar
custom_steps: WHEN user hovers cursor over an event's time
custom_expected: THEN the cursor arrow changes to a pointing hand

title: OBSOLETE - Calendar: view buttons shadow
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on the Calendar
custom_steps:
WHEN user clicks or taps on the Day view button
OR user clicks or taps on the Week view button
OR user clicks or taps on the Month view button
custom_expected: THEN the white shadow of the selected button turns dark gray

title: Calendar: hover over event
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Calendar
AND events appear on the Calendar
custom_steps: WHEN user hovers cursor over an event title
custom_expected:
THEN the title is underlined
AND cursor arrow changes to a pointing hand

title: 3 Calendar views - appearance
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is on the Global Calendar page
AND three buttons have appeared in the header on the right side of the screen: Day, Week, Month
custom_steps: WHEN user taps or clicks on one of those buttons
custom_expected:
THEN the calendar display changes according to the selection
AND the 3 view displays match the photos below

Month:
![](index.php?/attachments/get/19849)

Week:
![](index.php?/attachments/get/19850)

Day:
![](index.php?/attachments/get/19851)

title: Calendar: internal scroll bar
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on the Calendar
custom_steps:
WHEN user selects Day view
OR user selects Week view
custom_expected:
THEN an internal scroll bar appears on the page
AND the internal scroll bar is next to the lower, larger section of the page -- the time range grid
AND the internal scroll bar does not extend into the upper All Day grid section

AND WHEN user clicks and holds or presses on the scroll bar
AND user moves it up or down
THEN scroll bar moves up or down accordingly
AND the lower, larger section of the calendar page scrolls up or down accordingly
AND that time grid changes its display from midnight to midnight

title: Test responsiveness
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is on a desktop platform
custom_steps:
WHEN user decreases the viewport
AND WHEN user expands the viewport
custom_expected:
THEN all elements continue to appear on the page
AND no elements overlap any other in any viewport
AND images stay proportionate (not stretched or squished)
AND all elements function as expected.

Note: In Windows IE and Edge, Chatter images will be stretched.

title: Test mobile
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is using a mobile device
custom_expected:
THEN all elements appear on the page
AND no elements overlap any other
AND all elements function as expected
